tealsim.physics.em

Class AmperesLaw

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.sim.simulation.Simulation3D
        • teal.physics.em.SimEM
          • tealsim.physics.em.AmperesLaw
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, TElement, TElementManager, THasPropertyChange, HasFramework, HasEngineControl, TSimulation, HasGUI

    public class AmperesLaw
extends SimEM
    An application to show the tangent vectors and magnetic fields on the contour surrounding an open surface to make clear the geometric concepts behind Ampere's Law. We only allow lines of current either into or out of the page, all of the same strength.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    John Belcher
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Logical value for whether circle is visible.

        Logical value for whether rectangle is visible.

        Logical value for whether there are any line currents in the scene.

      • numberLineCurrents

        int numberLineCurrents
        Number of line currents in the scene, set to 2 for startup.

      • baseCurrentThruMeter

        Wall baseCurrentThruMeter
        Base for the current thru meter.

      • currentthrubaseLabel

        SpatialTextLabel currentthrubaseLabel
        Text label for the current thru meter.

      • currentthruMeterSizeBase

        double currentthruMeterSizeBase
        The size of the square for the base of the current thru meter.

      • oneUnitCurrentThru

        double oneUnitCurrentThru
        The height of the current thru meter rectangle for the current thru due to one unit of line current.

      • screenWidth

        double screenWidth
        The approximate width of the canvas in the standard view. We use this to draw a box around the LIC panel, which consists of four white lines, for contrast/appearance reasons.

      • arrowScaleBfield

        double arrowScaleBfield
        The scale factor for the magnetic field vectors on our surfaces. Increasing this value makes the field vectors larger.

      • arrowScaleTangent

        double arrowScaleTangent
        The scale factor for the surface normal vectors. Increasing this value makes the normal vectors larger.

      • scaleByMagnitudeBoolean

        boolean scaleByMagnitudeBoolean
        Boolean for whether we normalize B (false) or whether we allow the magnitude to show to some extent (true). The extent to which the magnitude is shown is determined by the variables normMagnitudeFactor and powerMagnitudeScale.

      • normMagnitudeFactor

        double normMagnitudeFactor
        If we scale by magnitude, the normalization factor we use.

      • powerMagnitudeScale

        double powerMagnitudeScale
        If we scale by magnitude, the power of the magnitude we let the scale vary by (less than or equal to 1).

      • posX

        double posX
        X position of the center of the amperean loop.

      • posY

        double posY
        Y position of the center of the amperean loop.
